section.title: Non-existent Limits
section.p: Many limit values do not exist. Sometimes the non-existence is caused by the function value either increasing without bound or decreasing without bound. In these special cases we use the symbols \infty and -\infty to communicate the non-existence of the limits. Figures can be used to illustrate some ways in which we communicate the non-existence of these types of limits.

li.p: In we could (correctly) write\lim\limits_{x\to-3^{-}}\fe{T}{x}=\infty\text{ and }\lim\limits_{x\to-3^{+}}\fe{T}{x}=-\infty\text{.} There is no shorthand way of communicating the non-existence of the two-sided limit \lim\limits_{x\to-3}\fe{T}{x}.
